intro: Crula sutchuenensis, commonly known as the Sichuan crula, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
